discussion.p: In the synopsis of the mutex_type typedef is specified as follows:
The comment seems ambiguous as it could mean either:

ol.li: sizeof...(MutexTypes) >= 1 and every type in MutexTypes... is the same type.

discussion.p:
I originally took the language to mean (2), but upon further review it seems that (1) is the intended interpretation, as suggested in the LEWG discussion in Lenexa.
I think the language should be clarified to prevent implementation divergence.
General feeling that sizeof(MutexTypes...) == 1 is a better way to state the requirement.
Reworked the text to refer to scoped_lock instead of lock_guard
Marshall and Eric to reword and discuss on reflector. Status to Open

li.p: Edit , class template scoped_lock synopsis, as indicated:

blockquote.p: -1- An object of type scoped_lock controls the ownership of lockable objects within a scope. A scoped_lock object maintains ownership of lockable objects throughout the scoped_lock object's lifetime (). The behavior of a program is undefined if the lockable objects referenced by pm do not exist for the entire lifetime of the scoped_lock object.

li.p: WhenIf sizeof...(MutexTypes) is 1one, let Mutex denote the sole type constituting the pack MutexTypes., the supplied Mutex type shall meet the Cpp17BasicLockable requirements (). The member typedef-name mutex_type denotes the same type as Mutex.
Otherwise, each of the mutex typesall types in the template parameter pack MutexTypes shall meet the Cpp17Lockable requirements () and there is no member mutex_type.
